title: Robust Financial Asset Acquisition
description: In 2020, Nauru achieved a net acquisition of financial assets equivalent to 30.74% of its GDP, showcasing a strong financial strategy.

title: Strong Fiscal Surplus
description: Nauru reported a net lending of 32.76% of GDP in 2020, indicating a significant fiscal surplus and effective budget management.

title: High Revenue Generation
description: In 2020, Nauru's revenue, excluding grants, was 138.99% of GDP, reflecting a robust revenue generation capacity.

title: Substantial Tax Revenue
description: Nauru's tax revenue constituted 44.40% of GDP in 2020, highlighting a strong tax collection system.

title: High Government Expenditure
description: In 2020, Nauru's government expenses were 103.73% of GDP, indicating high public spending.

title: High Tobacco Use Prevalence
description: As of 2022, 48.3% of adults in Nauru were current tobacco users, reflecting a significant public health challenge.

title: High Female Tobacco Use
description: In 2022, 48.1% of female adults in Nauru were tobacco users, indicating a concerning trend in female health behavior.

title: Significant Health Expenditure
description: Nauru allocated 15.79% of its GDP to domestic general government health expenditure in 2022, demonstrating a commitment to healthcare.

title: Minimal Greenhouse Gas Emissions
description: In 2023, Nauru's total greenhouse gas emissions, excluding LULUCF, were recorded at just 0.0012 Mt CO2e, one of the lowest globally.

title: Low Methane Emissions from Agriculture
description: Nauru's methane emissions from agriculture were only 0.0003 Mt CO2e in 2023, indicating minimal agricultural impact on the environment.

title: High Dependency on Imports
description: In 2023, Nauru's imports of goods and services amounted to $152.16 million, highlighting a significant reliance on external resources.

title: Limited Scientific Output
description: With only 0.27 scientific and technical journal articles published in 2022, Nauru shows limited engagement in scientific research.

title: Small Elderly Population
description: As of 2023, Nauru's population aged 65 and above totaled 318, reflecting a relatively young demographic.

title: Minimal Nitrous Oxide Emissions from Industry
description: In 2023, Nauru's industrial processes emitted only 0.0001 Mt CO2e of nitrous oxide, showcasing minimal industrial pollution.

title: Low Female Teacher Training in Primary Education
description: Only 8.33% of female teachers in primary education were trained in 2023, indicating a need for improved educational resources.

title: Minimal Neonatal Deaths
description: In 2023, Nauru recorded only 1 neonatal death, reflecting positive health outcomes for newborns.

title: High Personal Remittances Received
description: In 2023, Nauru received $880,605.81 in personal remittances, indicating strong financial support from abroad.

title: Low Population of Elderly Women
description: In 2023, only 0.094% of Nauru's female population was aged 80 and above, suggesting a younger female demographic.
